result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance S. Vandenbusch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 1/19/16 to include restitution.
**Amended 12/4/17 to indicate "Restitution to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision".
***Amended 10/23/19 to direct restitution and court costs to be collected through prison wages, and any monies gifted to the defendant are exempt from garnishment for restitution and costs.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with J.W. or her family.
Defendant shall have no non-adult unsupervised contact with any child under age 18 without express approval of Agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
